text: Warner McPherson (April 2, 1935 â€“ March 1, 2022), known professionally as Warner Mack, was an American country music singer-songwriter and guitarist. He was born in Nashville, Tennessee. His best known singles were "Is It Wrong (For Loving You)" in 1957 and in 1965 "The Bridge Washed Out". Mack died on March 1, 2022 in Nashville at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American gospel singers Category:American gospel musicians Category:American country singers Category:American country guitarists Category:American blues musicians Category:American blues singers Category:Musicians from Nashville, Tennessee Category:Singers from Nashville, Tennessee Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:Singers from Mississippi Category:People from Vicksburg, Mississippi
title: Warner Mack
